Headline: Gay Pakistanis, Still in Shadows, Seek Acceptance
Subheader: A support group in Lahore for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender Pakistanis aims to give a safe space to members as more try to gain family support, even in a climate of religious conservatism.

Headline: Ethel Person, Who Studied Sexual Fantasies, Dies at 77
Subheader: Dr. Person was a psychiatrist who examined what motivates transsexuals and transvestites, and argued that people shaped their lives by trying to live out their desires.

Headline: Malaysian Court Rejects Challenge to Cross-Dressing Ban
Subheader: An application to review an Islamic law that bars Muslim men from dressing as women was rejected on Thursday, raising fears that transgender people could face increasing prosecutions.

Headline: ‘Little Girl’ Review: Growing Up and Seeking Peace
Subheader: This sensitive documentary by the French filmmaker Sébastien Lifshitz naturalistically explores the struggles of a 7-year-old transgender girl.

Headline: Virginia School Board to Pay $1.3 Million in Transgender Student’s Suit
Subheader: Gavin Grimm sued the Gloucester County, Va., school board after he was barred from using the boys’ bathroom. The dispute put him at the center of a debate over transgender rights.

Headline: It’s Never Too Late to Follow Your Spiritual Calling
Subheader: After coming out as a transgender woman more than two years ago, Vica Steel never dreamed of forging a path to church leadership. Until now.

Headline: ‘Gender Alchemy’ Is Transforming Art for the 21st Century
Subheader: With the growing visibility of gender-nonconforming and transgender people, the scope of feminism is fast evolving. Now two major museum shows in California explore the impact on art.

Headline: Trans Rights and Gender Identity
Subheader: In “Trans: When Ideology Meets Reality,” Helen Joyce argues that sex is not just a social construct.

Headline: Since Suicide, More Resources for Transgender and Gay Students
Subheader: Rutgers University has rolled out more specialized housing options and other resources for its gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender students in the wake of Tyler Clementi’s death.

Headline: Transgender Woman Settles Suit Against Two Organizations
Subheader: Lana Lawless, the transgender woman who sued the L.P.G.A. and the Long Drivers of America last October challenging their rule that competitors be “female at birth,” has settled her case, her lawyer said.

Headline: For Transgender Detainees, a Jail Policy Offers Some Security
Subheader: Cook County Jail has instituted a new policy for transgender detainees, which includes a panel that determines whether they should be housed with men or women.

Headline: Ruling Extends Sex-Discrimination Protection to Transgender Woman Denied Federal Job
Subheader: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission said gender-identity bias is illegal under Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.

Headline: For Transgender Triathlete, a Top Finish in New York Is Secondary
Subheader: Chris Mosier, who will compete in the New York City Triathlon for the first time as a male, was picked on in high school and college for adopting an androgynous appearance.

Headline: Equality for Transgenders
Subheader: Readers respond to a column on civil rights for transgender Americans.

Headline: ‘Name Change’
Subheader: The filmmaker Sharon Shattuck recalls the apprehension she experienced when her father, a transgender cross-dresser, decided to legally adopt a woman’s name.

Headline: Anchorage Voters Reject Extension of Rights Protections to Gay Residents
Subheader: Proposition 5, a bill that would have added protections for people regardless of “sexual orientation or transgender identity” fell short in a citywide vote.

Headline: When They Play Women, It’s Not Just an Act
Subheader: Harmony Santana is among a small group of openly transgender actors who are increasingly recognizable and finding a place on screen.

Headline: We Want Cake, Too
Subheader: As progress on equality for gay men and lesbians ripples through the country, one group has been prominently left behind: transgender people.

Headline: Suits Dispute City’s Rule on Recording Sex Changes
Subheader: The city requires transgender people to have genital surgery if they want to change their sex identification on their birth certificates.

Headline: Medical Schools Neglecting Gay Health Needs, Study Says
Subheader: Medical school curricula in the United States and Canada devote an average of only five hours to the specific health care issues faced by lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender patients, a survey shows.

Headline: A First in Cup Qualifying for a Player and a Team
Subheader: Jonny Saelua, who is transgender, helped American Samoa to its first international victory with a 2-1 win over Tonga in World Cup qualifying on Tuesday.

Headline: Brian Winfield, Kim Byrd
Subheader: Both partners have been involved in organizations helping gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender people.

Headline: Xiomara Lorenzo, Cara Herbitter
Subheader: A wedding at the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Transgender Community Center in Manhattan.

Headline: The High Price of Looking Like a Woman
Subheader: Some transgender women seek out practitioners who will illegally, and dangerously, inject them with silicone to achieve a more feminine appearance.

Headline: Seeking Acceptance, and Family, in One’s Shifting Gender
Subheader: A respectful adaptation of the 2001 documentary of the same name, “Southern Comfort” chronicles the final year in the life of Robert Eads, a female-to-male transsexual who has ovarian cancer.

Headline: A Lawsuit’s Unusual Question: Who Is a Man?
Subheader: A lawsuit filed Friday by an employee who says he was dismissed for being transgender could turn on the question of who is or is not a man.

Headline: ‘Coming Out’: Gay Teenagers, in Their Own Words
Subheader: The project was initiated as an effort to better understand this generation of gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender youths, and to explore its realities and expectations.

Headline: 2011 Was a Good Year for Causes of Gays
Subheader: The battle over same-sex marriage continues, but for other causes supported by lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender groups, 2011 has been a particularly good year.

Headline: Idit Klein, Jordan Namerow
Subheader: A Massachusetts wedding for the executive director of Keshet, a Boston organization that works for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender equality, and the senior communications associate of American Jewish World Service, an international relief organization in New York.

Headline: For Many Older Gays, a Toll of Time and Isolation
Subheader: A geriatrician reflects on the challenges facing the aging generation of gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender people who are often more isolated than their heterosexual peers.

Headline: Week Ahead in Film
Subheader: A look ahead at NewFest, the New York Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Film Festival.

Headline: Brenda Fulton, Penelope Gnesin
Subheader: A founder of an organization that helps gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender service members and veterans marries a choir director.

Headline: Shades of Gay
Subheader: In a recent national survey, people of color were more likely than whites to identify themselves as lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender.

Headline: What Makes a Man (or Woman) in a Marriage License? In Texas, It’s Unclear
Subheader: Texas bans same-sex marriage, but the issue of transgendered applicants for a marriage license has thrown a wrinkle into the ban.

Headline: California May Require Teaching of Gay History
Subheader: Advocates hope that teaching about gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender people in schools would prevent bullying and shatter stereotypes.

Headline: Homeless Youth Struggles to Build a Life in Chicago
Subheader: Transgender and once a ward of the state, Juan Gallaher lost subsidized housing and other aid when he turned 21.

Headline: Gender-Free
Subheader: Justin Vivian Bond recalls the ups and downs of being a “trans child.”

Headline: Glittering Rage
Subheader: Glitter bombing is the latest act of political theater from the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender rights movement.

Headline: Schmekel, a Band Born as a Laugh
Subheader: Schmekel, a band of transgender Jewish musicians, merges traditional Jewish forms like klezmer with the aggressive energy of early gay punk bands.

Headline: Lawyer Turns From Jon Burge to Another Form of Injustice
Subheader: Joey Mogul, a Chicago lawyer, has turned her attention to the plight of gay men, lesbians, bisexuals and transgender people in the criminal justice system.

Headline: Out and Proud to Serve
Subheader: At 12:01 a.m. Tuesday, 1st Lt. Josh Seefried, who founded an undercover group of 4,000 gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender active-duty service members, dropped his pseudonym.

Headline: Celebration of Gay Pride Masks Community in Transition
Subheader: The gay community in San Francisco is at a complex crossroads. Assimilation is on the rise, but longtime gay and lesbian institutions are struggling.

Headline: NewFest Is Coming Out of the Margins
Subheader: For its 24th annual season, NewFest — which celebrates movies with lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender material — is under the auspices of the Film Society of Lincoln Center.

Headline: Atlanta Closer in Distance Than in Philosophy on Gay Marriage
Subheader: Despite a large and vibrant community of gay, lesbian and transgender people in Atlanta, Georgia and its largest city are far from approving anything close to New York’s law.

Headline: Manicures and Compassion for ‘Throwaway People’ in the Tenderloin
Subheader: A missionary group offers cosmetics and compassion to transgendered people and women in the Tenderloin nail salon, many of them former sex workers.

Headline: A Son Confronts Gender Identity and a Mother Grieves
Subheader: Sharon Weir may not be happy that her son is openly gay and identifies himself as transgender, but she will fight for his right to exist in peace.

Headline: Obama’s News Conference
Subheader: The following is a transcript of Obama’s news conference in the East Wing, as provided by the White House.

Headline: Crossing the Gender Frontier: Voices of Pioneers
Subheader: Readers respond to a recent column Maureen Dowd on transgendered people.

Headline: The Road to Acceptance
Subheader: A reader responds to “The Transition to My Real Self” (Preoccupations, March 6).

Headline: Transgender Comedy Not Amusing to Some
Trailer to Change for Transgender Film
Decision on Transgender Player
Subheader: More than two months after a transgender woman sued the Long Drivers of America claiming discrimination, the group said in a statement that it planned to follow a recent rule change by the L.P.G.A.

Headline: Advocates Hope Transgender Identity Is Not a Defining One
Subheader: Gains by transgender candidates are being hailed by advocates as both a sign of acceptance and, they hope, a sign that actual issues are being valued more than gender stereotypes.

Headline: Transgender Man Is on Women’s Team
Subheader: Kye Allums, a guard on George Washington’s women’s basketball team, may be the first Division I college basketball player to publicly compete as a transgender person.

Headline: For Transgender People, Name Is a Message
Subheader: Manhattan Civil Court has become a capital of name changing for transgender people as the stigma eases.

Headline: L.P.G.A. Tour Accepts Transgender Players
Subheader: L.P.G.A. players have voted to eliminate the tour’s requirement that players be “female at birth” and to allow transgender athletes to compete.

Headline: California: Transgender Candidate Is New Judge
Subheader: Voters in the San Francisco Bay Area elected the first transgender trial judge in the country.

Headline: L.P.G.A. Will Allow Transgender Players to Compete
Subheader: The L.P.G.A. was sued in October by Lana Lawless, a retired police officer who had gender reassignment surgery in 2005.

Headline: Guard Held in Sexual Attack on Transgender Inmate
Subheader: The victim, a transgender woman, was improperly placed in a male housing unit of the jail, her lawyer complained.

Headline: Transgender Woman Sues L.P.G.A. Over Policy
Subheader: A transgender woman filed a federal lawsuit Tuesday against the L.P.G.A., arguing that its requirement that competitors be “female at birth” violates California civil rights law.

Headline: When to Out a Transgender Dater?
Subheader: Private (to a point); prize or payola?

Headline: Letters: The Ethicist, Outing the Transgender Dater
Subheader: Readers respond to an article about privacy.

Headline: U.S. Job Site Bans Bias Over Gender Identity
Subheader: Civil liberties groups called it a clear statement that discrimination against the transgender population in the federal workplace would not be accepted.

Headline: A Caged Bird Sings the Blues About a Life of Not Fitting In
Subheader: In her solo show “A Night at the Tombs,” the transgender performer Bianca Leigh reflects on her life during a night of incarceration.

Headline: Bold Crossings of the Gender Line
Subheader: There are visible bits of evidence that 2010 will be remembered as the year of the transsexual.

Headline: Edward Farley and Matthew Horowitz
Subheader: In Vermont, a lawyer who represents gay, lesbian, transgender or bisexual people affected by domestic violence marries a talent agent.

Headline: A Gay Campaign? Both Sides Demur
Subheader: Brittany Novotny, a Democrat and Oklahoma’s first known transgender candidate, is running for a seat in the state House against a Republican incumbent.

Headline: The Anatomy of a Breakup
Subheader: A partner transitions genders and a relationship changes and breaks.

Headline: Race to Succeed Chris Daly Reflects a Transformed District
Subheader: Candidates for District 6 seat on the San Francisco Board of Supervisors vividly illustrate the sea change that is transforming the area.

Headline: Giving Voice to the Once-Silent
Subheader: The Original Plumbing magazine, a publication for transmen, serves as a voice for a group seldom heard.
